de.slackspace.openkeepass

Class KeePassDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.slackspace.openkeepass.KeePassDatabase

  • public class KeePassDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    A KeePassDatabase is the central API class to read and write a KeePass database file.

    Currently the following KeePass files are supported:

    • KeePass Database V2 with password
    • KeePass Database V2 with keyfile
    • KeePass Database V2 with combined password and keyfile
    A typical read use-case should use the following idiom: 
     // open database
 KeePassFile database = KeePassDatabase.getInstance("keePassDatabasePath").openDatabase("secret");

 // get password entries
 List<Entry> entries = database.getEntries();
 ...
    If the database could not be opened an exception of type KeePassDatabaseUnreadable will be thrown.

    A typical write use-case should use the following idiom: 

     // build an entry
 Entry entryOne = new EntryBuilder("First entry").username("Carl").password("secret").build();

 // build more entries or groups as you like
 ...

 // build KeePass model
 KeePassFile keePassFile = new KeePassFileBuilder("testDB").addTopEntries(entryOne).build();

 // write KeePass database file
 KeePassDatabase.write(keePassFile, "secret", new FileOutputStream("keePassDatabasePath"));
    See Also:
    KeePassFile

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KeePassDatabase getInstance(java.lang.String keePassDatabaseFile)
        Retrieves a KeePassDatabase instance. The instance returned is based on the given database filename and tries to parse the database header of it.
        Parameters:
        keePassDatabaseFile - a KeePass database filename, must not be NULL
        Returns:
        a KeePassDatabase

      • getInstance

        public static KeePassDatabase getInstance(java.io.File keePassDatabaseFile)
        Retrieves a KeePassDatabase instance. The instance returned is based on the given database file and tries to parse the database header of it.
        Parameters:
        keePassDatabaseFile - a KeePass database file, must not be NULL
        Returns:
        a KeePassDatabase

      • getInstance

        public static KeePassDatabase getInstance(java.io.InputStream keePassDatabaseStream)
        Retrieves a KeePassDatabase instance. The instance returned is based on the given input stream and tries to parse the database header of it.
        Parameters:
        keePassDatabaseStream - an input stream of a KeePass database, must not be NULL
        Returns:
        a KeePassDatabase

      • openDatabase

        public KeePassFile openDatabase(java.lang.String password)
        Opens a KeePass database with the given password and returns the KeePassFile for further processing.

        If the database cannot be decrypted with the provided password an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        password - the password to open the database
        Returns:
        a KeePassFile
        See Also:
        KeePassFile

      • openDatabase

        public KeePassFile openDatabase(java.lang.String password,
                                java.io.File keyFile)
        Opens a KeePass database with the given password and keyfile and returns the KeePassFile for further processing.

        If the database cannot be decrypted with the provided password and keyfile an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        password - the password to open the database
        keyFile - the password to open the database
        Returns:
        a KeePassFile
        See Also:
        KeePassFile

                                java.io.InputStream keyFileStream)
        Opens a KeePass database with the given password and keyfile stream and returns the KeePassFile for further processing.

        If the database cannot be decrypted with the provided password and keyfile stream an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        password - the password to open the database
        keyFileStream - the keyfile to open the database as stream
        Returns:
        a KeePassFile
        See Also:
        KeePassFile

      • write

        public static void write(KeePassFile keePassFile,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         java.lang.String keePassDatabaseFile)
        Encrypts a KeePassFile with the given password and writes it to the given file location.

        If the KeePassFile cannot be encrypted an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        keePassFile - the keePass model which should be written
        password - the password to encrypt the database
        keePassDatabaseFile - the target location where the database file will be written
        See Also:
        KeePassFile

      • write

        public static void write(KeePassFile keePassFile,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         java.io.OutputStream stream)
        Encrypts a KeePassFile with the given password and writes it to the given stream.

        If the KeePassFile cannot be encrypted an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        keePassFile - the keePass model which should be written
        password - the password to encrypt the database
        stream - the target stream where the output will be written
        See Also:
        KeePassFile
